snippet: The German town where Pope Benedict XVI was born never prospered as much as it hoped from its famous son, and it seems likely to get even fewer visitors after he steps down.
abstract: Marktl Am Inn Journal; residents of Marktl Am Inn, German town where Pope Benedict XVI was born, never prospered as much as was hoped after he became pope, and town will likely get even fewer visitors after he steps down.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy reported from Marktl am Inn, and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The German town where Pope Benedict XVI was born never prospered as much as it hoped from its famous son, and it seems likely to get even fewer visitors after he steps down.

headline.seo: Pope’s Birthplace, Marktl am Inn, Laments Resignation
headline.main: Hitching a Name to a Star, Then Watching It Set
headline.print_headline: Hitching a Name to a Star, Then Watching It Set
